title: Is one's consciousness but a small part of a bigger consciousness, consisting of the consciousness of all people together? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes…but more broadly. One’s consciousness is a small part of The One Consciousness, consisting of Everything and the Nothingness or Emptiness that contains the Everything…not just the other human consciousnesses. Consciousness is just Pure Being, Pure Is-ness. There’s nothing “there” yet. That’s why the Absolute is always characterized as being Unmanifest. Consciousness then projects the illusion of everything: universes, planets, beings, and the false sense of “individuality” and the sense that we are “separate” from It. So feeling like we’re just one small, separate life, “broken off” from Consciousness and subject to “dying” or ceasing to exist, is part of Consciousness’ Divine Play. It couldn’t explore & discover Itself the way It must unless it temporarily created this false sense that these parts of It called “people” were actually separate entities who feel disconnected from It. It “needs” that to play out It’s Play. So it’s totally OK if “we” feel separated for awhile. Note: There’s considerable “poetic license” in all I just said, because the mind cannot grasp this and words are totally inadequate to convey this vast & perfect Reality. At the level of Pure Consciousness, there is no “time” or “space,” so there’s no “there” and no “then” when Consciousness projects this illusion out of Itself. It all exists Now, simultaneously. And Pure Consciousness is just pure functioning. It does not have any “needs” or “reasons” why it projects, or seems to project, this Play. You can’t grasp this with your mind, but you can be This, abide in This, and then you see that it’s all true. You also lose your sense of being one small part of a bigger consciousness and become, or return to being, the Bigger Consciousness you always were.

The way I see it, consciousness is not a ‘thing’ or a substance. A thing can be one or many. A substance occupies a space. Consciousness is neither these things. In fact, the very word ‘consciousness’ is a noun but I don’t think of consciousness as a noun at all. It is a verb: to be conscious. When I say “my consciousness” I am using wrong language. Consciousness is not a thing nor is it mine. But I say ‘my consciousness’ because that is how we say it in language. When I look at my consciousness, I don’t see it having any quantity, and shape, any size, any location, any duration, etc… In fact, since consciousness is not a thing I cannot look at it. Just like I cannot look at the wetness of water, I can only look at water. All the consciousness of all beings together is simply the universe. The universe has no existence apart from the observation or consciousness of it. In fact, it is like a dream. Each person has their own Universe which they exist in the center of, appearing to their senses. There is no one objective Universe which exists bigger than us. Each person is their own Universe. You appear in my Universe or dream but not at the center where I am. I appear in your Universe or dream but not at the center where you are. Just like a dream, the dream is not a part of a bigger dream realm consisting of all beings’ dreams together. No, a dream is an ephemeral experience that appears nowhere. Same with each person’s experience.
